content.title: Financial Assistance For Cultural Activities In Performing Arts For Building Grants Including Studio Theatres
content.beneficiary: Voluntary cultural organizations and government-aided cultural organizations
content.details: The scheme aims to support voluntary cultural organizations and government-aided cultural organizations in their efforts to create appropriately equipped training, rehearsal, and performance spaces for artists.
benefits: Maximum assistance of ₹50 lakhs for projects involving new construction or the purchase of built-up space in metro cities.
Maximum assistance of ₹25 lakhs for all other projects in metro cities.
Maximum assistance of ₹25 lakhs for all projects in non-metro cities.
eligibility: The organization has a predominantly cultural profile, working primarily for the promotion of arts and culture for at least three years.
The organization is registered as a society under the Registration of Societies Act or similar Acts, or as a Trust or Not-for-Profit Company for at least three years.
The organization is well-established and known for meaningful work in the field of its activity.
exclusions: Schools, colleges, or University Departments/Centres not specifically dedicated to the performing arts.
content.application_process: Offline. Applications should be sent to The Director, West Zone Cultural Centre, Udaipur, Rajasthan, along with complete enclosures by Speed Post or Registered Post.
documents_required: Project Report/Proposal including organization profile and project description.
Copy of the Certificate of Registration under the Societies Registration Act.
Copy of the Memorandum of Association or Trust Deed.
List of present members of the Board of Management.
Copies of Annual Accounts for the last 3 financial years.
Copy of the Title Deed for the project.
Copy of Building/Development Plans approved by the local authority.
Cost estimates approved by a registered Architect.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: To support voluntary cultural organizations and government-aided cultural organizations in creating training, rehearsal, and performance spaces for artists.

faqs.question: Which ministry has started the scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Culture, Government of India.

faqs.question: Is this scheme centrally sponsored?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is centrally sponsored.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance will be provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Maximum financial assistance of ₹50 lakhs for new construction or purchase of built-up space in metro cities, and ₹25 lakhs for all other projects.
